title: hd49728
author: hd49728
content: This is the Genesis block of Bitcoin blockchain.https://www.blockchain.com/explorer/blocks/btc/0Genesis blockThe miner is Satoshi Nakamoto with this Coinbase messageQuoteCoinbase MessageEThe Times 03/Jan/2009 Chancellor on brink of second bailout for banksSome information on Blockchain.com explorerQuoteBitcoin GenesisOn January 3rd 2009, the Bitcoin network was created when Satoshi Nakamato (the project's mysterious creator) mined the “Genesis” block. The 50 bitcoin coinbase reward is unredeemable, as it was omitted from the transaction database. This means any attempt to spend it would be rejected by the network. Whether this was intentional or not still remains unknown.A total of 0.00 BTC ($0.00) were sent in the block with the average transaction being 0.0000 BTC ($0.00). Satoshi earned a total reward of 50.00 BTC $0.00. The reward consisted of a base reward of 50.00 BTC $0.00 with an additional 0.0000 BTC ($0.00) reward paid as fees of the 1 transactions which were included in the block.The Bitcoin Genesis block reward was sent to this address of Satoshi Nakamoto 1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNahttps://www.blockchain.com/explorer/addresses/BTC/1A1zP1eP5QGefi2DMPTfTL5SLmv7DivfNaPeople still sent satoshi to the address. Like dusts with values smaller than transaction fees.QuoteThis is the Genesis address, it is owned by Satoshi Nakamoto and contains the unspendable 50 bitcoin mined from the genesis block.Bitcoin Balance72.74312021SummaryThis address has transacted 6,575 times on the Bitcoin blockchain. It has received a total of 72.74312567 BTC $3,292,629 and has sent a total of 0.00000000 BTC $0.25 The current value of this address is 72.74312021 BTC $3,292,629.What mining pool will celebrate it with a Coinbase message this year?

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Yeah in TradFI many are speculating that tomorrow will be the day that the etf gets the approval. So it coincides with the Jan 3rd genesis block launch date.Today prior to NY open the futures went crazy. Had a huge premium over spot. Seems something leaked and someone knows something because this is unusual trading activity.

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: So it's been 15 years since the first block was mined. What do you think? Has bitcoin evolved the way you wished it would? I learnt about bitcoin relatively late, but I think 15 years is a very good anniversary, isn't it?

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Time flies!It's (2014) like yesterday that I randomly read about how you could use bitcoin to buy games online and after a little more research I was hooked. A decade later and I'm glad I found out about this fantastic innovation QuoteThe 50 bitcoin coinbase reward is unredeemable, as it was omitted from the transaction database. This means any attempt to spend it would be rejected by the network. Whether this was intentional or not still remains unknown.It's a bit nitpicky but that reward was never part of the spendable outputs to be omitted As for the reason I would like to point out that whether it was intentional or not it's a good thing that it is not part of the spendable UTXO set because the 50BTC reward of block #0 is technically premined...

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Time has passed quickly, 15 years, a very long time, and because of Coinbase Message, many believe that Satoshi was in UK, and from him began the story of the most famous face of Satoshi, circulating until now. after the next 15 years, we will have judged Bitcoin. Either it is a realistic thing and will continue to exist, or it will turn into something like gold that will not be used in daily transactions, or it will fail and return to 0, as it began in Genesis block.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: pooya87 on January 03, 2024, 08:37:29 AMTime flies!It's (2014) like yesterday that I randomly read about how you could use bitcoin to buy games online and after a little more research I was hooked. A decade later and I'm glad I found out about this fantastic innovation I am so impressed because you digged a hole and got hooked by it for years. The impression is mainly because you learned about Bitcoin, not only to use it like other Bitcoin users but you actually learned deep enough to become one of Bitcoin experts in Bitcointalk community.I read your posts many times and see they are very knowledgeable, insightful and admire you a lot but I don't have technical background in programming to understand it all.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: 15 years have already passed by? it still feels like it was a few years ago. Those were the days when very few knew about Bitcoin and now a new generation of Bitcoiners are already in the making. So many changes have happened from 2009 to 2024, if I went on writing about it there wouldn't be space left here. The only thing that is left for me to say today is Happy Birthday, Bitcoin!

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: And people still think Bitcoin is scam despite Bitcoin has been 15 years old. The most interesting thing is when bull run happens, there's a spike during that moment. So yeah we can expect another spike during end of this year or next year.Long live Bitcoin! let's prove everyone there's no better cryptocurrency except Bitcoin.

comments.author: so98nn
comments.body: Quote from: apogio on January 03, 2024, 08:22:47 AMSo it's been 15 years since the first block was mined. What do you think? Has bitcoin evolved the way you wished it would? I learnt about bitcoin relatively late, but I think 15 years is a very good anniversary, isn't it? Oh yeah, it is a lot of time to consider the development of the human brain OR technology. Nonetheless, Bitcoin doesn't need to prove itself for anything. What was dreamt is running smoothly today and I don't think Satoshi would have ever imagined that Bitcoin will go this far. If they are still alive then man they must have watery eyes with happiness all over their faces. Oh and let's not forget they also hold a big chunk of share out of those millions of Bitcoins so who knows how that master mind is still in play? The 15 years of Journey they made a lot of changes "cosmetically". What I mean is, different products and services were launched around Bitcoin economy. Various aggregators came in so that they can link Bitcoin and real world economics to work parallel. Idk, as technology it was self sufficient. The only thing that needs to get developed is scalability problem.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Apocollapse on January 03, 2024, 10:21:19 AMAnd people still think Bitcoin is scam despite Bitcoin has been 15 years old. The most interesting thing is when bull run happens, there's a spike during that moment. So yeah we can expect another spike during end of this year or next year.Long live Bitcoin! let's prove everyone there's no better cryptocurrency except Bitcoin.If they did not buy bitcoin buy bought Bitcoin forks which are dead coins or if they bought Wrapped Bitcoin tokens that are not bitcoin too, and lost money to those altcoins, they had reasons to say Bitcoin is scam.They are wrong from the start and at the end because what they bought and lost money to, is not Bitcoin. Bitcoin forks, Wrapped Bitcoin tokens are scam and can die but Bitcoin is not scam and won't die.How Many Bitcoin Forks Are There?A beginner's guide to understanding wrapped tokens and wrapped Bitcoin

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Quote from: so98nn on January 03, 2024, 10:25:54 AMOh yeah, it is a lot of time to consider the development of the human brain OR technology. Nonetheless, Bitcoin doesn't need to prove itself for anything. What was dreamt is running smoothly today and I don't think Satoshi would have ever imagined that Bitcoin will go this far. If they are still alive then man they must have watery eyes with happiness all over their faces. Oh and let's not forget they also hold a big chunk of share out of those millions of Bitcoins so who knows how that master mind is still in play? Yes but it's not only a matter of price. I mean perhaps Satoshi wouldn't believe Bitcoin would be worth $45k usd, but there are some other aspects that Satoshi imagined that didn't go exactly according to plan.I am a bitcoiner, don't get me wrong, but Satoshi's whitepaper had a promising title "Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System". Unfortunately, Bitcoin is worth a lot today if you exchange it for USD, but in terms of usage it is still too far behind from becoming a proper P2P cash system. That said, we must focus on this and make Bitcoin a better cash system than the current one we live with.

comments.author: pinggoki
comments.body: Quote from: pakhitheboss on January 03, 2024, 10:13:12 AM15 years have already passed by? it still feels like it was a few years ago. Those were the days when very few knew about Bitcoin and now a new generation of Bitcoiners are already in the making. So many changes have happened from 2009 to 2024, if I went on writing about it there wouldn't be space left here. The only thing that is left for me to say today is Happy Birthday, Bitcoin! 15 years?! I didn't feel bitcoin to be that old holy moly! Maybe because I've started young in bitcoin that I don't feel the time that's passed by on the history of bitcoin. I'm happy that I begun at the early years of bitcoin, and knowing the potential that it can go from here on out, I'm lucky considering there's going to be more people that's going to be introduced to bitcoin. I'm glad that I've was introduced to bitcoin, wouldn't be meeting wonderful people if I wasn't.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Happy 15th year anniversary. With that small beginning, it has changed a lot of lives. Can we imagine how all of these 15 years have changed everyone's life?Whether you've been here a few years or long time ago, it is for sure that Bitcoin has a significant impact to our lives and it has changed a lot to us with how we look this life, finances, etc.As in everything that all matters to us.Thanks satoshi and all the OGs who contributed well to this project. Waiting for the ETF approval.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Bitcoin is really a great technology that has striven hard and surfaced in times of bad markets after dropping a great deal. Some years ago, after a significant drop in the price of Bitcoin, many people who were against it said it was Bitcoin's obituary because, to them, Bitcoin was going to die, but surprisingly, Bitcoin is still waxing strong. The technology is just 15 years old, meaning it's still a teenager  , but yet it's the greatest asset that many people desire to have. What if Bitcoin becomes a full-grown adult in the few years to come? It simply means that there are more great heights that Bitcoin will accomplish, and for those thinking that they are late to investing in Bitcoin, they are still very early to the technology.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: with today's flash crash   it was a great way to celebrate and be able to stack more satoshi obviously the events are not related to each other, but the approval of the SPOT ETF in conjunction with this anniversary would not be bad  but I am a bit skeptic on that ...

comments.author: okae
comments.body: Happy 15th year anniversary!!!My God, 15 years!!! time passes very fast and Bitcoin is just an adolescent yet... i feel like great things are coming in the next years... Dont forget our history and go on guys!!!Thanks to everyone who made it possible!!!

comments.author: thecodebear
comments.body: Happy 15 year anniversary to Bitcoin!Just in November I passed my 10 year anniversary of first time I heard about and bought bitcoin.The past 15 years has seen Bitcoin grow from a single person to an experimental currency to an investors get rich quick scheme to global financial asset and even adopted as legal tender in a country. Hopefully the next 15 years we see the public get educated on Bitcoin and its gets normalized in society and becomes a normal way for people to not just save money but also spend money.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on January 03, 2024, 04:13:03 AMThis is the Genesis block of Bitcoin blockchain.Did you see the new release of Satochip limited edition card hardware wallet pack inspired by Genesis block message?This is a cool collectibles item, but it can also be used as hardware wallet and as seed phrase backup.Quote from: dkbit98 on December 30, 2023, 09:38:07 AM You can purchase this Satochip The Times Edition pack on their official website

comments.author: tread93
comments.body: Thanks for sharing this wonderful framed copy of the genesis block in physical form! If that belongs to you then congratulations it belongs in a museum. Satoshi's patientence paid off with that one because it is such a profound statement to embed into the very first block. Man I wish I had a physical copy of that one they are no doubt highly valuable. Crazy to think now that was 15 years ago!

comments.author: Tyke
comments.created_time: January 05, 2024, 09:47:13 PMLast edit: January 05, 2024, 10:01:17 PM by Tyke
comments.body: Progress continues with the Bitcoin history book:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5475400.0Please leave feedback and community support is much appreciated. The 3rd January 2009 Genesis block is covered in the book (see link in above thread opening post).
